thread.title: Storms batter Brainerd area, shut Madden's Resort for two weeks
thread.title_full: Storms batter Brainerd area, shut Madden's Resort for two weeks

author: Mark Reilly
title: Storms batter Brainerd area, shut Madden's Resort for two weeks
text:
Storms batter Brainerd area, shut Madden's Resort for two weeks Jul 14, 2015, 6:44am CDT Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Share Save Article Campgrounds and resorts in the Brainerd area turned away tourists after taking damage and losing hundreds of trees (and electricity too) during Sunday's storm. KSTP-TV reports that Madden's Resort on Gull Lake will be closed for two weeks to recover from the storm, which brought strong winds, hail and flash flooding to much of the state. Madden's, which sent hundreds of guests to a storm shelter on Sunday, is now in the process of clearing downed trees. The Star Tribune reports that Cragun’s Resort has also shut down after losing power . Home of the Day See All Homes of the Day The Brainerd Dispatch reports that the storm also did extensive damage to the Brainerd International Raceway facility, flipping over a section of grandstands near the raceway's drag strip and blowing the roof off a media tower. The raceway — which on Monday was looking for help from people with chainsaws — said it didn't plan on delaying upcoming events. 
Want Minneapolis / St. Paul Travel news in your inbox? Sign up for our free email newsletters. #BIR is looking for volunteers with chain saws, and or ANY help to clean up the track. The Only cancelled event is... http://t.co/fyLcHgLAHM — Brainerd Int Raceway (@BIRrace) July 13, 2015 Industries
